    • Method Detail

      • getLastVersion

        public java.lang.String getLastVersion()
        Returns:
        The version name of the last installation of this app (as described in the former manifest). This will be the same as returned by getThisVersion() the second time this version of the app is launched (more precisely: the second time ChangeLog is instantiated).
        See Also:
        AndroidManifest.xml#android:versionName

      • getThisVersion

        public java.lang.String getThisVersion()
        Returns:
        The version name of this app as described in the manifest.
        See Also:
        AndroidManifest.xml#android:versionName

      • firstRun

        public boolean firstRun()
        Returns:
        true if this version of your app is started the first time

      • firstRunEver

        public boolean firstRunEver()
        Returns:
        true if your app including ChangeLog is started the first time ever. Also true if your app was deinstalled and installed again.

      • getLogDialog

        public AlertDialog getLogDialog()
        Returns:
        An AlertDialog displaying the changes since the previous installed version of your app (what's new). But when this is the first run of your app including ChangeLog then the full log dialog is show.

      • getFullLogDialog

        public AlertDialog getFullLogDialog()
        Returns:
        an AlertDialog with a full change log displayed

      • getLog

        public java.lang.String getLog()
        Returns:
        HTML displaying the changes since the previous installed version of your app (what's new)

      • getFullLog

        public java.lang.String getFullLog()
        Returns:
        HTML which displays full change log

      • dontuseSetLastVersion

        public void dontuseSetLastVersion(java.lang.String lastVersion)
        manually set the last version name - for testing purposes only
        Parameters:
        lastVersion -
